metadata.title: CVE-2019-11729 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Empty or malformed p256-ECDH public keys may trigger a segmentation faultdue values being improperly sanitized before being copied into memory andused. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 60.8, Firefox < 68, andThunderbird < 60.8.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11729` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss3 - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm1
libnss3-1d - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm1
libnss3-nssdb - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm1
libnss3-tools - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
nss package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm1').
